column4: Under Windows I have a dynamic DNS updater which works rather well.
I presume there's equivalents for Linux
That way you can have a standard hostname (usually whatever.dyndns.org) and it works reliably.
there is one module for dydns in webmin
The Windows one I use is called DNSser
It's hardly rocket science. You could probably write it as a shell script.
well yah .. so why not you write one ?
All it usually does is requests the status page from the router every so often, greps out the IP, compares it with last time, and requests a URL at dyndns.org if it's different.
